content.heading: HTML Elements
paragraphs: An HTML element is defined by a start tag, some content, and an end tag.

content.heading: HTML Elements Structure
paragraphs: The HTML element is everything from the start tag to the end tag:
<tagname>Content goes here...</tagname>
Examples of some HTML elements:
My First Heading
My first paragraph.

content.heading: Nested HTML Elements
paragraphs: HTML elements can be nested (this means that elements can contain other elements).
All HTML documents consist of nested HTML elements.

The following example contains four HTML elements (, ,

, and

):

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
My First Heading

My first paragraph.

content.heading: Explaination
paragraphs: The <html> element is the root element and defines the whole HTML document.
It has a start tag <html> and an end tag </html>.
Inside the <html> element, there is a <body> element:

My First Heading

My first paragraph.
The <body> element defines the document's body.
It has a start tag <body> and an end tag </body>.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
My First Heading

My first paragraph.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
My First Heading

My first paragraph.

content.heading: Never Skip the End Tag
paragraphs: Some HTML elements will display correctly, even if you forget the end tag. However, never rely on this! Unexpected results and errors may occur if you forget the end tag.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
This is a paragraph

This is a paragraph

content.heading: Empty HTML Elements
paragraphs: HTML elements with no content are called empty elements.

The
tag defines a line break and is an empty element without a closing tag.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
T his is a
paragraph with a line break.

content.heading: HTML is Not Case Sensitive
paragraphs:
HTML tags are not case sensitive:

means the same as

.
The HTML standard does not require lowercase tags, but W3C recommends lowercase in HTML.
